column4: you may want to read the guide a bit further for the trouble shooting
there is a file you must edit if you want to enable hardware acceleration
I suppose you're referring to xorg.conf? I've edited to match the correct settings, but what I think i'm missing is nvidia-glx-new for my new kernel
which one are you using now?
did you download the binary driver nvidia-glx?
yes its there, remember this was all was working until I updated my kernel from 2.6.24 to 2.6.25
i would reboot the computer then
wouldn't restarting X be sufficient, but I still dont see how thats taking care of the problem because in synaptic my nvidia-glx-new is 169.12+2.6.24.13-1, and 2.6.25 isn't listed there
your system is still running on the old kernel it seems, rebooting the system will start your new one
i admit im no pro at tech support but if i have a problem with my kernel i reboot
if you wish you can restate your problem so someone else can help you
